Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
===============
eXtraction Path
===============

.. IMPORTANT::

  This module is in the "planning" stage (i.e. no code to download
  yet).

Apply XPath_ expressions to extract objects from *any* Python objects.

For XML-based objects, this library defers to the standard
ElementTree_ implementation.

For non-XML-based objects, it provides a pure-Python implementation of
the XPath_ spec... with some "caveats". Since Python objects are not
XML objects, things like a "namespace" need to be adapted in terms of
exactly what they mean.

.. _XPath: https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath/
.. _ElementTree: https://docs.python.org/2/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#elementtree-xpath
info.name: xpath
info.summary: A python library to extract objects from an object tree.
info.html_description:
Important

This module is in the “planning” stage (i.e. no code to download yet).

Apply XPath expressions to extract objects from any Python objects.

For XML-based objects, this library defers to the standard ElementTree implementation.

For non-XML-based objects, it provides a pure-Python implementation of the XPath spec… with some “caveats”. Since Python objects are not XML objects, things like a “namespace” need to be adapted in terms of exactly what they mean.
